page.title: 12Life Styles(Survey)
page.content: {Holidays: }Over 60% of the people went on holiday at least once a year, some went perhaps 2 or 3 times a year. 50% of these holidays were in Britain the rest were abroad. The most popular holiday was self-catering or camping although hotels also proved quite popular. {Pets:}56% of the sample kept some kind of pet, cats, dogs and rabbits were the most popular. {Possessions:}Every person in the sample possessed their own TV. Over 78% owned their own car, stereo and washing machine. Approximately 40% owned videos and computers. {Household Tasks:}There tended to be male and female tasks within the home; women usually cooked and cleaned, men did car cleaning and household repairs whilst jobs such as gardening and washing_up were shared.
